product_name: DrybarThe Double Shot Oval Blow-Dryer Brush
summary: SummaryBlow-drying made easy! The Double Shot Oval Blow-Dryer Brush from Drybar combines the hot air of a blow-dryer with the structure of a round brush to create a smooth, shiny blowout with tons of volume in one quick, simple step.
details: DetailsFeaturesIonic Technology reduces frizz and adds tons of shine while stylingStrategically-placed vents provide maximum airflow for a faster blowoutErgonomic, lightweight design provides maximum comfortA combination of nylon and tufted bristles allows for exceptional tension and control2.44" oval shape with gently curved edges provides tons of volume and a smooth finish3 temperature settings (cool/medium/high) allows for customized styling of all hair typesGuaranteed with a 2-year limited manufacturer's warrantyItem 2558174How To UseAfter shampooing, thoroughly towel-dry hair to remove excess water.* Brush out hair using a detangling brush or comb, and separate into large sections. Place the Double Shot underneath each section and work it slowly from roots to ends, until the section is dry and smooth. For volume at the roots, use horizontally at the crown. The Double Shot can also be used on dry hair to create a smooth, finished look.*For extra-thick or long hair, it may be necessary to rough-dry hair with a regular blow-dryer before using The Double Shot.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: After shampooing, thoroughly towel-dry hair to remove excess water.* Brush out hair using a detangling brush or comb, and separate into large sections. Place the Double Shot underneath each section and work it slowly from roots to ends, until the section is dry and smooth. For volume at the roots, use horizontally at the crown. The Double Shot can also be used on dry hair to create a smooth, finished look.*For extra-thick or long hair, it may be necessary to rough-dry hair with a regular blow-dryer before using The Double Shot.

reviews.headline: Outstanding!!!
reviews.comments: Absolutely love it!! It dries my hair quickly and I love that you have to use larger sections for f hair. This makes my hair fuller and shiny. This has been my most favorite hair dye in years. I will never use any other product.

reviews.headline: Broke The first time I used it
reviews.comments: This cheap blow dryer brush broke on me the first time I used it. What a piece of junk

reviews.headline: Not worth the premium price
reviews.comments: I bought this thinking that a better quality styler would actually be better but it isn't. It runs WAY too hot and burns the nubs of the ends of the bristles not to mention how bad it is for your hair. The Revlon is a much better value for the money.

reviews.headline: Not good!
reviews.comments: So my daughter purchased this from our local Ulta and I figured it would be good since it is a dry bar product. I was the first one to use it, and I used it on wet hair and the drying time was fine. However, the end result was not good. It made my hair feel as if it were doll hair in the regards of it being tingly. I don't believe this unit is hard enough to leave the (Hair) looking smooth and polished. My daughter used it a couple days later and had the same if not worse results than I did. Sadly, we will be returning this product.

reviews.headline: I've had this for a year and still love it!
reviews.comments: I have had this for a full year and it works great still! I use it about 2-3 times a week. I have thick wavy hair. If this were to go out, I would definitely buy another one!

reviews.headline: Did not dry/ smooth out my hair like my cheaper Revlon Brush
reviews.comments: Did not dry/ smooth out my thick hair. My old Revlon brush dryer works better for me.

reviews.headline: Wow
reviews.comments: I first got my double shot in 2020, and it changed my life. Best blow dry brush I've ever tried, as someone with 3b hair. Yes after like 2 years they glitch, but there's a warranty for a reason!!! Love this, will repurchase!

reviews.headline: Torn making this
reviews.comments:
I'm torn making this review. I've gone through 2 of these. One was a gift, lasted about 2.5/3 years. The bristles and brush were practically flat. The second i purchased in April 2023. It's now May 2025 and they are messed up, flat and missing. 

I'm torn writing this because the blowdryer does wonders to my hair! However, the longevity of this blowdryer even with mostly regular upkeep it still gets messed up.

reviews.headline: Short-lived
reviews.comments: I bought mine brand new in the store. I had hoped that spending more for a trusted brand meant it would last a long time and work well. I was glad there's a warranty just in case. It didn't even last two months and the motor died! And the warranty process is lengthy. They received my old one over a week ago and still haven't shipped a new one. I do love the bristles on this one better than other brands I've bought. But it didn't even last two mos!?

reviews.headline: Great but died after 2 yearsâ€¦
reviews.comments: Bought this november 2022, its may 2025, and it just overheated to the point the handle was so hot my hands were burning and it stopped blowing air. Ive ised this teice a week every week and its such a great product. It saves me time and with my wavy hair i can skip straightening with it. The price its too much for a product that doesnt last 5+ yearsâ€¦. Make a better product or lower the cost.

reviews.headline: Very weak bristles
reviews.comments: I purchased the oval once and round x2. I have a short bob cut, hoping these bldryer would work perfect but NOT the case. lThe bristles bend and become weak. Hair gets caught and pulls too.

reviews.headline: Absolutely love this tool it leaves my hair soft silky .
reviews.comments: Absolutely love this tool it leaves my hair soft silky and healthy..

reviews.headline: Can't live without this now!
reviews.comments: I use this on my dry or damp hair for smoothness. I absolutely love it!!

reviews.headline: 2X purchase; both malfunctioned
reviews.comments: I purchased this product twice. Once I was gifted and I loved it, but it went out after 2 uses, I almost though I was about to be electrocured and sounded like it was going to   blow up. I thought maybe it was that soecific one and I purchased another which also did the same thing after 3 uses and it completely stopped working, wouldnt even turn on. This cant be a coincidence.

reviews.headline: Disappointed
reviews.comments: This blowdry brush works very well, and my first one lasted 2-3 years. My second one however, lasted less than 6 months, and gave out without warning. I reached out to ULTA who suggested I reach out to the manufacturer. I have called and waited on hold and sent emails to DryBar and have yet to receive a response. I moved on to the Kristen Ess blowdry brush which is a 3rd of the price and works just as good. Have been with that one now about 5 months and hopefully it will keep going.

reviews.headline: Fantastic-for only 3 months
reviews.comments:
I bought this expensive blow dryer TWICE!
Initially it works great. Blowout is a smooth salon quality finish. After 3 months the bristles wear out and the blowout is frizzy. Trying to get the results I had initially, I bought it again. Same thing happened within 3 months. Frizzy hair.

reviews.headline: Not worth the money
reviews.comments: My husband gifted this hair dryer to me maybe 2 years ago. It was great at first but now its like ive had this thing for 10 years. The bristles are warped so badly and the handle gets burning hot when using that its hard to hold. I think its a better investment if youre thinking of spending this kind of money to buy the shark blow dryer where you can purchase new attachments for $30 when needed whereas this you have to spend another $155. Save your money and make an investment

reviews.headline: Poor Quality
reviews.comments: ive had this for about a year and a half and it does work and definitely gives beautiful results every time. with that being said, within a few months of having it the handle started getting really hot. i still use it in spite of this but i have to use it for like 30 seconds, then put it down because it starts burning my hand to hold. the bristles have also melted and bent over time which hasnt affected how my hair looks but it still says something about the quality. this also leaves my room smoky. it still works but its definitely not great quality especially since theres so many others that will last longer

reviews.headline: Had promise
reviews.comments: I loved this brush at the beginning but after less than a year of 1x a week use, it suddenly started tripping my switches in my house and wouldnt stay on! The red button flashes and says "if flashing dont use this outlet. Tried it in multiple houses/outlets and it had the same issue every time so its the product, not my house. It's really disppointing that it didnt last a year at that price.

reviews.headline: Amazing
reviews.comments: I have tried a quite a few blow dryer brushes, and finally gave this one a shot when I bought the bundle on sale that included a few of their products. I regret not buying this sooner. Out of all my brushes, this one doesn't feel like it's pulling my hair out as I am drying. It's very gentle. It gets hot, but not nearly as hot as the others. Dries my hair fast, and gives me a great blow out every time. Loved it so much, I took advantage of the sale and bought the half shot too, which is also an amazing tool.

media.headline: Debated for months and so glad I bought one!
Debated for months and so glad I bought one!

faceoff_positive.comments: For someone like me who has had super thick hair her entire life, finding a dryer that cuts dry time and styles just the way I want it seemed almost impossible. I've tried MULTIPLE dryer brushes (one actually caught fire because it just couldn't handle this thick mane of mine) and non of them lasted long. I was told about the drybar brand and to try the double shot dryer. So I figured if it works, I don't mind spending the money. I love it, but my only issue is with having thick hair the bristles don't last long with these kinds of dryers. The dryer works great after having it just over a yr, but unfortunately the bristles are falling off and/or are burned which sucks since this isn't a cheap product. I wish this one came with changeable brush heads so I can toss the beat up one. Other than that, this dryer is great, just sad that I may have to look for other options
faceoff_positive.headline: Double shot

faceoff_negative.comments: I've had it for 9 months and it'sâ€¦not good. I feel like the cheap Revlon brush is better and I am definitely going to move up to the Dyson air wrap. This gets so hot it burns the yellow tips (making them brown) before each individual brush falls off completely (see pic). Super bummed.
faceoff_negative.headline: Piece of junk

rollup.name: The Double Shot Oval Blow-Dryer Brush
